sentence.Network_en: I'm going out myself with the adjutant to recce training areas.
sentence.Network_cn: 我要亲自和副官出去侦察一下训练地区.

sentence.Network_en: Outside the sergeant - adjutant knelt down beside me where I lay, " Name? " he asked softly.
sentence.Network_cn: 到了外边,军曹副官跪在我的身边, “ 贵姓? ” 他轻轻地问.

sentence.Network_en: Also did not take adjutant, did the general leave alone so?
sentence.Network_cn: 也没带副官, 将军就这样只身离去了?

水的英文翻译 ... Middle English 中古英语 (=Adjutant) 人事行政参谋, 助手 (=Afro-American) 美国黑人的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (in the sense 'assistant, helper'): from Latin adjutant- 'being of service to', from adjutare, frequentative of adjuvare 'assist' (see adjuvant)

entry.def: An adjutant is an officer in the army who deals with administrative work.

means.word_mean: 1. an officer who acts as military assistant to a more senior officer
2. large Indian stork with a military gait

auth_sentence.content: The Drill-Adjutant, approaching...to learn why one squad was delayed in dismissal.
